## Overview

## Simulation

Let's set a random number generator seed (to make sure that this simulation is fully reproducible) and simulate the exponential distirbution.  
We are conducting two simulations.

```{r}
set.seed(seed = 10)
n <- 1000
lambda <- 0.2
sample.size <- 40

population <- rexp(n,lambda)
means <- sapply(seq_len(n), function(x) mean(rexp(sample.size,lambda)))
```

## Sample Mean versus Theoretical Mean
```{r}
library(ggplot2)
ggplot(data.frame(x=c(population,means), label=factor(rep(c("population","means"),c(n,n)))),aes(x, fill=label))+geom_density(alpha=0.2)+geom_vline(xintercept = 1/lambda, size=1, color="red")+geom_vline(xintercept=mean(means),color="blue")+labs(title="Sample mean (sample size=40) versus Theoretical Mean")+annotate("text", label = "Theoretical mean= 1/lambda", x = 6, y = 0.3, size = 4, colour = "red", hjust=0)
```
 
## Sample Variance versus Theoretical Variance
```{r}
theoretical<-rnorm(n,mean=1/lambda,sd=1/lambda/sqrt(sample.size))

ggplot(data.frame(x=c(means,theoretical), label=factor(rep(c("means","theoretical"),c(n,n)))),aes(x, fill=label))+geom_density(alpha=0.2)+geom_vline(xintercept = 1/lambda, size=2, color="red")+labs(title="Sample mean (sample size=40) versus Theoretical Mean")+annotate("text", label = "Theoretical mean= 1/lambda", x = 6, y = 0.3, size = 4, colour = "red", hjust=0)
```
